business.headline: Domestic mutual funds boost Paytm stake by 1% this quarter, total holdings now at 8%The latest shareholding pattern filed by the company shows a 1% increase in stake by mutual funds as the trust grows on the brand and its ability to bounce back.

Succession Wars: How betrayal, murder and greed tore apart 'House of Gucci'Maurizio Gucci's quest to perfect the family empire ended in four gunshots on March 27, 1995, on the steps of his Milan office.

Isha Ambani is Harper's Bazaar Icon of the Year, dedicates award to mother, daughterIsha Ambani dedicated the award to her mother, Nita Ambani, the Chairperson of Reliance Foundation. Isha said her mother is her role model who has "paved the way for me".

Centre recommends reducing GST on packaged water and bicycles below Rs 10,000The Group of Ministers (GoM) to decide on GST on health and life insurance premiums in its meeting on Saturday decided to exempt GST on premiums paid by individuals, other than senior citizens, for health insurance with coverage of up to Rs 5 lakh.

Who is Vasundhara Oswal, daughter of Indian billionaire, detained in Uganda?Vasundhara Oswal was reportedly seized by a group of 20 armed men at the family's extra neutral alcohol (ENA) plant. Local officials have connected her arrest to an ongoing investigation into the case of a missing person.

HDFC Bank Q2 results: Net profit rises 5% to Rs 16,820 croreHDFC Bank's net interest income (NII), a key measure of profitability, came in at Rs 30,114 crore, reflecting a 10% year-on-year increase, although slightly below the market expectation of Rs 30,306 crore.

Karnataka to impose cess on Zomato, Uber, payments to support gig workersKarnataka Labour Minister Santosh Lad said that the charge would be levied only on transport and not on the purchase of products.

Disney-Reliance venture to stream live sports exclusively on Hotstar: ReportWhile Reliance's JioCinema currently streams IPL cricket, Hotstar holds rights to other prestigious events like the International Cricket Council (ICC) tournaments, the English Premier League, and the Pro Kabaddi League.

Ashneer Grover withdraws mismanagement plea against BharatPe from NCLTThe plea alleged mismanagement and oppressive conduct by the fintech company's board. The withdrawal of the plea follows a settlement reached between Grover and BharatPe on September 30, 2024.

India to impose laptop import restrictions to boost local manufacturing: ReportThe planned restrictions, if enforced, could impact the country's IT hardware market, which is currently valued at between $8 billion and $10 billion.
Sensex, Nifty close in green as banking, metal stocks lift marketThe S&P BSE Sensex added 218.14 points to close at, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 104.20 points to end at 24,854.05.

DA hike by 3%: Check new salary, arrear calculations for employees, pensionersThe DA hike increase is effective from July 1, 2024, and was confirmed during a Cabinet meeting chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday.

India's growth rate shines bright in global economy, says Ajay Banga A lot of that growth is in India, is driven by the domestic market as well, which actually is a healthy sign, in some ways, said Ajay Banga, World Bank president.

IGL, MGL shares plunge up to 15% today. Here's why MGL's stock plummeted 11%, reaching a low of Rs 1,568.30, while IGL experienced a 10% drop, closing at Rs 453.70 on the Bombay Stock Exchange as of latest update.

Vistara to operate with 'AI 2' code after merger with Air IndiaVistara, a joint venture between the Tata Group and Singapore Airlines Limited (SIA), is set to formally merge with Air India on November 12, 2024.

Hyundai IPO: GMP signals discounted listing, but can it pull off a surprise?Hyundai IPO listing: Despite the buzz around the automaker's stock market debut, analysts and investors are divided on whether the stock will exceed expectations or struggle, given current market signals.
Explained: Why Infosys shares fell 5% after Q2 results Infosys share price: Infosys reported a profit after tax (PAT) of Rs 6,506 crore for the second quarter (Q2) ending in September 2024.

Wipro shares gain 4% post Q2 results, bonus issue news. Time to buy? The rally came after Wipro announced its second-quarter (Q2) results for the fiscal year 2025 (FY25), posting a 21.3% year-on-year (YoY) jump in net profit to Rs 3,209 crore.
Amazon AWS CEO warns staff: Return to office or resignAmazon AWS CEO Matt Garman defended the decision to implement a five-day in-office work week starting in January 2024.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Doctor, non-locals, among 7 killed by terrorists in Jammu and KashmirSeven people killed by terrorists were part of the construction team working on the Z-Morh tunnel, which connects Gaganeer to Sonamarg in Central Kashmir's Ganderbal district.

Devendra Fadnavis, Chandrashekhar Bawankule in BJP's first list for MaharashtraThe BJP released its first list of candidates for the Maharashtra Assembly election. Devendra Fadnavis, Chandrashekhar Bawankule, Ram Kadam, and Nitesh Rane are among the 99 candidates named by the party.

Multiple agencies probe Delhi school blast, forensic teams test mysterious powderThe National Investigation Agency (NIA) is inspecting the area near a CRPF school in Delhi's Rohini, where a blast occurred on Sunday morning, to determine if there are any terror links to the incident. Forensic teams have arrived at the scene and are analysing a white powder-like substance found near the school's wall.

Justin Trudeau made sure ties with India go downward: Outgoing Indian envoyIn an interview with Canada's private broadcaster CTV, Sanjay Kumar Verma, the outgoing Indian High Commissioner to Ottawa, said Justin Trudeau has made sure that the bilateral relations with India "only go downwards, spiralling down".

Yahya Sinwar's wife had Rs 27 lakh Birkin inside tunnel before Oct 7 attack: IsraelVideo shows Sinwar walking in an underground tunnel with his wife and children, carrying supplies before the October 7 attack. Notably, Sinwar's wife was seen holding a Birkin bag worth $32,000 (around Rs 27 lakh).
Congress may sit out of UP bypolls after Samajwadi's 2-seat offer: SourcesThe Congress feels that it would be better for the party not to contest than to fight on just two seats, sources said.

Kerr heroics power New Zealand to maiden Women's T20 World Cup title Women's T20 World Cup 2024: Sophie Devine's New Zealand clinched their maiden Women's T20 World Cup after beating South Africa by 32 runs in the final. Amelia Kerr was the star for them in the summit with 43 runs and three wickets.

Chandrababu Naidu proposes law to incentivise families with more childrenChandrababu Naidu also urged families to consider having more children, pointing out Andhra Pradesh's ageing population and its long-term impact on the country's demographic balance.

How F&O addiction is turning dreams into debt for retail investorsThe high-stakes world of Futures and Options trading is attracting millions of Indians. It is mostly younger investors who are betting big on F&O despite lacking awareness. Experts see gambling-like behaviour as people keep investing even while losing money. Is there a way of being successful in F&O trading?

IIT Delhi's Technology & AI Leadership Programme: Shaping the Future of Tech LeadershipAdvance your career with IIT Delhi's Technology & AI Leadership Programme. Designed for aspiring tech leaders, this programme offers cutting-edge insights, practical experience, and strategic acumen to navigate the digital era. Gain the skills to drive innovation, lead digital transformations, and position yourself as a visionary in technology leadership.

Rajasthan: The Royal Canvas for Dream WeddingsWhether it's the grandeur of a palace wedding in Udaipur, the mystique of a desert wedding in Jaisalmer, or the creativity of a themed wedding in Jaipur, Rajasthan offers a wedding experience that is truly out of the ordinary.
12 bombers on six IndiGo flights: Threat message posted on XThe message claimed that there were 12 bombers spread across six Indigo flights, with two bombers on each plane.

Actor Neelam Kothari tears up talking about her first marriage: Lost my identityActor Neelam Kothari shared the emotional hardships she faced during her first marriage. Her revelations offer a glimpse into the personal struggles and identity issues she grappled with.

Why Varanasi awaits a new bridge over the GangaWith four railway tracks and a six-lane highway, the Rs 2,642-crore bridge is among the many upgrades to the city's infrastructure since becoming the prime minister's constituency

Baba Siddique murder: Mumbai Police arrests man who provided weapon to shootersThe accused has been identified as Bhagwat Singh Om Singh (32), originally from Udaipur in Rajasthan who is currently staying in Navi Mumbai.

Gauri Lankesh murder accused removed from Shinde Sena day after joiningShrikant Pangarkar, who is currently out on bail, is an accused in the high-profile murder case of journalist Gauri Lankesh in 2017.

Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Eye patients in Gujarat hospital woken up, made BJP members; party denies chargeA hospital in Rajkot has been accused of enrolling as many as 350 eye surgery patients as BJP members without their consent, sparking outrage and prompting investigations.

Uddhav Sena, Congress turn to Sharad Pawar to resolve seat-sharing woes: SourcesAccording to sources, both Congress and Shiv Sena (UBT) leaders have reached out to NCP (Sharadchandra Pawar) chief Sharad Pawar to mediate and resolve the differences in the opposition alliance.

Watch: Moment explosion took place near CRPF school in DelhiVisuals from the area showed plumes of smoke rising near the school in the Prashant Vihar locality. In another footage, a loud explosion can be heard clearly.

Somy Ali on should Salman Khan apologise to Bishnoi community: It makes no senseIn an exclusive interview with us, Somy Ali opened up on Lawrence Bishnoi's threats to Salman Khan and why she wants to meet the gangster.

Suraj Mal, the Jat ruler who plundered Delhi and never bowed to MughalsSuraj Mal, a Jat ruler, rose from the heartlands of Braj (Mathura) to challenge the Mughal empire. His strategic brilliance and indomitable spirit expanded his kingdom across fertile lands, making Bharatpur a bastion of Jat power in the chaos of the 18th century.

CSK CEO reveals MS Dhoni's IPL retention plan: 'Will tell you before Oct 31'IPL 2025 Retention: Chennai Super Kings CEO Kasi Viswanathan said the five-time champions are hopeful of retaining MS Dhoni for the next season. Dhoni has remained tight-lipped about his future as a player in the IPL.

Video: Rani Mukerji attends Karwa Chauth festivities at Anil Kapoor's homeActor Rani Mukerji arrived at Anil Kapoor's residence to attend Karwa Chauth festivities. Every year, Anil's wife Sunita Kapoor organises a pooja followed by celebrations on Karwa Chauth. This year, many celebrities including Rani, Shilpa Shetty, Mira Rajput and Raveena Tandon attended the festivities. Rani looked beautiful dressed in pink.

Kichcha Sudeep in tears as he hugs Basavaraj Bommai at his mother's funeralActor Kichcha Sudeep was inconsolable at his mother Saroja Sanjeev's funeral. He broke down in politician Basavaraj Bommai's arms.

Anita Dongre wins Best Fashion Designer at Harper's Bazaar Women of the Year AwardsAnita Dongre was awarded Best Fashion Designer at the Harper's Bazaar Women of the Year Awards. The unique event celebrated women's power with a 'chain of empowerment' theme.

Jonita Gandhi wins Best Musician at Harper's Bazaar Women of the Year Awards 2024The Harper's Bazaar Women of the Year Awards celebrated influential women, including Jonita Gandhi, who was honoured in the musician category. Gandhi dedicated her award to her mother and highlighted the importance of female friendships in her journey.

sports.headline: Historic Test win, T20 World Cup win: New Zealand's special SundayNew Zealand cricket fans enjoyed a historic Sunday on October 20, as both the men's and women's teams clinched major victories. The men's side defeated India in Bengaluru, while the women's team lifted their maiden T20 World Cup trophy in Dubai.

Salah stars as Liverpool thump Chelsea for a 2-1 win at AnfieldLiverpool regained the Premier League top spot with a solid 2-1 win over Chelsea at Anfield, thanks to a composed penalty from Mohamed Salah and a brilliant Curtis Jones finish, securing yet another home victory for the in-form Reds.

Pant's cryptic post after Bengaluru Test defeat: Let God show peopleRishabh Pant shared a cryptic Instagram post following India's defeat in the Bengaluru Test, hinting at a focused mindset and determination to help the team bounce back in the upcoming second Test against New Zealand in Pune.

Aiden Markram ready for Bangladesh 'spin challenge' in Mirpur TestBAN vs SA: Aiden Markram said that South Africa have the resources to counter Bangladesh's spin attack in the opening Test, starting October 21 at the Sher-e-Bangla National Stadium.

John Stones gives stoppage-time 2-1 win to Manchester City over WolvesManchester City snatched a thrilling 2-1 victory over Wolverhampton Wanderers, thanks to John Stones' stoppage-time header. The comeback, led by Stones and Josko Gvardiol, secured City's temporary return to the top of the Premier League table.

Bangladesh vs South Africa: When and where to watch 1st Test? BAN vs SA: Najmul Hossain Shanto's Bangladesh will lock horns with South Africa in the opening Test, starting October 21 at the Sher-e-Bangla National Stadium in Mirpur.

Virender Sehwag suggests domestic route to struggling Babar Azam for comebackFormer India opener Virender Sehwag has suggested Pakistan batter Babar Azam to play domestic cricket and stay mentally strong to make national comeback.

Suzie Bates breaks Mithali Raj's record for most women's internationalsWomen's T20 World Cup 2024 Final: Veteran Suzie Bates set the record for the most-capped player in women's internationals, going past the legendary Mithali Raj.

Neymar returns from injury for Al Hilal after one year on the sidelinesNeymar Jr has returned to training for Al Hilal after a year-long ACL injury, making him available for the club's AFC Champions League clash against Al-Ain. His return brings renewed excitement for both Al Hilal and the Brazil national team.

Women's T20 World Cup Final: Devine inspired by New Zealand men's India heistNew Zealand women's captain Sophie Devine said that she's drawing inspiration from the men's team which beat India by eight wickets in the first Test in Bengaluru to register their first Test win in India after 36 years.

Shanto gives a funny response on Shakib Al Hasan's apology status BAN vs SA: Najmul Hossain Shanto added humour to the pre-match press conference while taking on the apology message dropped by Shakib Al Hasan on his social media account.
Ranji Trophy: Ruturaj Gaikwad, Yash Dhull score fighting centuries in Round 2Ruturaj Gaikwad and Yash Dhull scored fighting hundreds on Day 3 of the Round 2 fixtures of the Ranji Trophy 2024-25.

IND v NZ: Washington Sundar added to India squad for second and third TestsIndia vs New Zealand: India added Tamil Nadu all-rounder Washington Sundar to their squad for the second and third Tests against New Zealand in Pune and Mumbai. Rishabh Pant was retained in the squad despite his knee niggle in Bengaluru.

Head pulls out of Pakistan ODI series for family time before India TestsAustralian batter Travis Head will miss the upcoming white-ball series against Pakistan to spend time with his family ahead of the high-stakes five-Test series against India, starting November 22 in Perth.

Rishabh Pant was retained in the squad despite his knee niggle in Bengaluru.

Head pulls out of Pakistan ODI series for family time before India TestsAustralian batter Travis Head will miss the upcoming white-ball series against Pakistan to spend time with his family ahead of the high-stakes five-Test series against India, starting November 22 in Perth.

Latham keeping 'fingers crossed' on Williamson's return for Pune TestIND vs NZ: Tom Latham shared an update on Kane Williamson, saying that he's not 100 percent sure about his return in the second Test in Pune. Williamson missed the opening Test in Bengaluru due to a groin strain. 

"I'm sure those conversations will be had over the next 24-48 hours, I guess anyone of Kane's calibre, if he's right and able to come back and decide, that would be obviously great.

"But yeah, I guess selection headaches are obviously always a great thing to have from a team point of view. So, fingers crossed he'll be right. I'm not 100% sure on his return yet, but fingers crossed he can get over here as soon as possible," he signed off.

Sarfaraz Khan won't suffer Karun Nair's fate, will play Pune Test: Aakash ChopraIndia vs New Zealand: With Shubman Gill expected to return for the Pune Test, India will to have drop either KL Rahul or Sarfaraz Khan from the XI. India lost the series opener in Bengaluru by 8 wickets despite Sarfaraz's second-innings heroics.

Neeraj Chopra brushes India vs Pakistan rivalry in javelin face-off vs Arshad NadeemNeeraj Chopra brushed aside any notion of India-Pakistan rivalry when he took on Paris Olympic gold-medalist Arshad Nadeem in the javelin throw competition, replacing the same seen in cricket and hockey.

Rohit Sharma was not at his tactical best in Bengaluru Test: ManjrekarSanjay Manjrekar criticised Rohit Sharma's tactical decisions during India's first Test defeat to New Zealand, particularly questioning the bowling order and underutilisation of Ashwin. Manjrekar believes these mistakes contributed significantly to India's 7-wicket loss in Bengaluru.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
